$ZIM   Some comforting math n stuff..
- ZIM pays just under 75% of its profits out in dividends.
-  If ZIM earns 250M per Q (1B per year)
- 750M divided by 120M total shares = a bit over $6 per share in annual divvy income
- $20 investment pays $6 annually is 30% return in just dividends. 😂😂

"While it is true that Zim is likely to experience a hefty drop-off from both a top- and bottom-line standpoint this year
created_at: the stock is arguably being valued as if the company is in deep financial trouble. Nothing could be further from the truth.

body: In its latest earnings report
created_at: Zim's management highlighted the fact that the company ought to generate an adjusted earnings before interest
column4: depreciation and amortization (EBITDA) of between $1.8 billion and $2.2 billion in 2023. That amount definitely qualifies as a fairly healthy and robust business even if it does represent a sharp drop-off from the company's pandemic highs over the course of 2021 to 2022. Turning to the specifics
column5: Zim posted adjusted EBITDA of $7.54 billion in 2022 and $6.60 billion in 2021."
